reviews.sentence: Very nice hotel but in my opinion deceiving. I thought I was saving money by staying away from the beachfront but it still cost about the same. This hotel does not provide free Wi Fi but charges you a fee for it. The valet parking is nice but charges you a daily fee. We were never given the option or direction to self park only valet parking and a nice charge on our bill. While getting morning coffee that we had to pay for another guest vomited right in front of my husband after the guest just having left the hotels bar located in the lobby. The hotel has six elevators and my daughter and I at one time waited 20 minutes for an elevator that had enough room for two more people to fit.

Slow elevators. We literally waited for an elevator for more than 10 minutes. It appears there are 6 elevators but some of them must not be functional. There was fuzzy stuff growing in the vent area in the shower. The housekeeper had not cleaned our room by 430 pm but made it clear she expected a tip. The waterside restaurant had good food although very slow on a Friday night in an empty restaurant. The location of the hotel on the river walk was nice. I would not stay here again.

Pay also for breath. The view from my window and the fact that Is very close at Amelie ArenaYou have to pay for everithing the room was without frigo bar. no free wi fi in the room just in the lobby no breakfast and for a 360 dollar rate it is not acetabile when in Miami South Beach in a Small hotel one block from the ocean my room was with everithing included plus sleepers and bathrope and daily rate 200 dollar chipper.

Quality of Service. I stayed at the Mariot Tampa for a convention. The staff was exceptionally nice from the front desk to the concierge lounge. They were nice and helpful. There was a maintenance issue that kept reocuring but the staffs efforts to accommodate was great. Hazel Williams stayed on top of the issue and eventually had me moved to a nicer room with a porch. She checked on me each time she saw me to make sure everything was good. Also Carl Fuller in the Concierge Lounge was very helpful in providing the services there. He made sure we were aware that they were pulling down the continental breakfast so we would have an opportunity to go back one last time. The gym leaves something to desire with just a few pieces of equipment which was a surprise for a hotel of that size. The hotel is very conveniently located food convention center trolley downtown interstate to name a few. The key for the stay was the the great customer service. That is what one would expect from a quality hotel such as the Mariot.

Definite disappointment. I recently attended a conference and had the choice between the Mariot or Westin. I did not hesitate when I chose the Mariot based on my stays at other Mariot properties. I quickly realized I may have buyers remorse. The room was nice enough however the 2 or 3 elevators would be down all at the same time. This left only 1 remaining elevator working. As a result the line to get into an elevator would be longer than a Disneyland attraction ride. The gym was efficient enough. The staff was also nice. However I mostly rated this hotel with a 3 mainly because of the jambalaya they provided on one of the days there. That was delicious.

Close to arena and local dining. Amazing hotel. Great breakfast. Elevator congestion around peak check in time no complaints. Water view room amazing for sunset. Parking is tight. Use valet. short wait 15 min. plan in advance if checkout time sensitive. Great staff btw Starbucks on site.

I stayed here for a conference across the street and I would opt to stay elsewhere next time. 1. There are 25 floors of rooms and only one set of elevators so you may be waiting 15 30 minutes to get where you need to go. This can be problematic if you are on a timed schedule for a conference. 2. Internet is 16 day and is necessary for conferences when you are accessing online abstracts schedules etc. 16 x 4 64 which is more than I pay for a month of internet at home3. There is nowhere to park. You must either use valet or park in a random lot in Tampa. Waiting on valet to retrieve your vehicle can be a 30 45 minute wait. Valet is 24 night. Overall the experience felt like a desperate grab for money.
I only went inside the lobby for a picture of a sand sculpture.

We keep returning. This was our fifth stay here prior to a Caribbean cruise. We cruise often from Port of Tampa and in the past have stayed at Hyat Embassy Suites Residence Inn among others. Based on our own experience we now stay exclusively at this property. We ran into considerable traffic delay in the city. There were more than the usual traffic detours and road closures due to construction. Thankfully our GPS compensated for the many detours and we arrived close to noon. Check in was smooth And we were upgraded to a water view room on the 25th floor. Our room was in excellent condition very clean and attractive. The mattress was very comfortable towels large and fluffy and a large tv with numerous channels. Unlike our most recent stay here all elevators were running without incident. We love to have drinks on the outside patio overlooking the marina river walk and savor Johny Walker with others who enjoy a cigar. Hopefully the road repairs construction will be finished when we return.

Stability of High Quality Staff Makes a Major Difference at this Hotel. Just back from my tenth stay at this Mariot. This property is staffed my hospitality professionals at every level. Jack at the Pool Bar very knowledgeable in football Brian Echler and Sam at the Bell Services and others make a major difference in this hotel in delivering a uniformly good experience over the years. Staff is trained to move quickly to watch and anticipate a guests needs thereby making for a very efficient operation. New elevator system and investments in Pool area make the experience that much better versus previous years. Very early last Sunday morning I was staring out at the rain in an empty rear area of the lobby. An employee came over and asked if there was anything they could do assist. Turns out the employee was the Resident Manager Eric Hoefen of two years. Never experienced that at a Hyat or Westin. Leverage the local knowledge of the staff members to better enjoy the interesting city of Tampa.
Convenient to cruise port. Great hotel very nice accommodations. Good restaurants too.
The staff was amazing and the accommodations were great.

Great Customer Service. I recently stayed at the hotel for a conference. Although the Concierge Lounge was closed the staff was extremely gracious and provided great amenities Free full breakfast buffet free appetizers from the bar free bottled water upon my request. Mary Margaret was really helpful printing several documents I needed to review.

Exceptional. Beautiful Waterfront location spacious and beautifully decorated room. staff were all amazing from front desk to valet great bar in lobby close to Arena. Food was awful which I hate to say because everything else was amazing super overpriced which I do n’t even mind if it ’s good but unfortunately everything we ordered was terrible.

Road Trip to Hockey Game. Booked here because of location right next store to Amalie Arena. Drove up from Collier Country for Lightening game. Excellent location. Just walked to the game. Very nice clean room with all the amenities for this type of hotel. Approach to hotel very difficult and confusing due to construction. Should be fine when finished but get your directions straight before that happens. Check in slow due to heavy volume andor lack of enough clerks. Lobby restaurant pretty good for hotel motel food. Convenience outweighed everything else and service was quick and good. Bottom line the only place to stay if you are bound for hockey.

Great location right next to the Convention Center and the River Walk. Clean quite comfortable and modern rooms with great beds. Friendly and helpful staff throughout the hotel. Nice bar and restaurant with good food and exceptionally good desserts. 6 super fast elevators. Large beautiful lobby.

Great facility OK service. The facility is fine clean well maintained but going through some renovation while we were there. When checking in we were asked if we wanted to participate in the green option or something similar and we said that we had prefer to have the room checked every other day. By the 4th day housekeeping had not yet made an appearance the trash baskets were overflowing and we were nearly out of toilet paper. Not a crisis but not great. Housekeeping did show up later the 4th day. When ready to check out we went to the valet to request our car and bell service for a luggage cart. We returned to the lobby 10 minutes later with our luggage and our car was not yet there so we waited and waited. After about 20 minutes we asked about our car and the keys were still on the key rack they had not gone to get it. Again not a crisis but it seems there is a lack of attention to detail. I had definitely recommend the hotel the location is great and near the conference center.

Excellent stay at a major hotel. Not usually a big fan of mainstream large hotels I really enjoyed my stay at this Mariot hotel. My room was quiet and very comfortable. The lobby was stylish but unpretentious. The lobby bar and its personnel were very accommodating and fun. VERY convenient to the convention center.
